DOC.brief_summary: To reduce antipsychotics to under 1000mg in patients with schizophrenia taking more than 1000mg/day and to evaluate relationship between relapse and cognitive function.
DOC.brief_title: Correlation Between Cognitive Function and Relapse of Schizophrenia Regarding Dose Reduction of High-dose Antipsychotic Therapy
DOC.criteria: inpatients with a diagnosis of schizophrenial, and those in the chronic phase receiving mean daily antipsychotic doses exceeding 1000mg CPZ eq./day. mental retardation, substance abuse or dependence, a history of major head trauma, serious medical or neurological disorders, or depot antipsychotic injections within the previous 3 months and electroconvulsive therapy within the previous 6 months
